snippet: While Intel’s profit rose significantly, concerns remain about whether it can move beyond its focus on putting chips in personal computers and servers.
abstract: Intel reports fourth-quarter net income of $3.7 billion, or 74 cents per share, up 37 percent from year-earlier period; reports 2014 revenue of $55.8 billion, though its key mobile device area reports losses of some $4.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: While Intel’s profit rose significantly, concerns remain about whether it can move beyond its focus on putting chips in personal computers and servers.

headline.main: Intel Profit Rises 39%, but Losses in Mobile Devices Are Heavy
headline.print_headline: Intel Profit Rises 39%, but Losses in Mobile Devices Are Heavy
